version_description:
Thanks to your feedback, in this release we fixed:
• An "unexpected error" on EA6350 and EA6900. If you've seen this, set your Parental Controls rules again.
• An "unexpected error" when adding a router to your account. Update your firmware if you still see this.
• An "unexpected error" saving Parental Controls rules.
• "Log in locally" option may not appear.
• Online router appearing offline.
Still having trouble? Email linksysappfeedback@belkin.com

Thanks to your feedback, in this release we fixed:
• An "unexpected error" on EA6350 and EA6900. If you've seen this, set your Parental Controls rules again.
• An "unexpected error" when adding a router to your account. Update your firmware if you still see this.
• An "unexpected error" saving Parental Controls rules.
• "Log in locally" option may not appear.
• Online router appearing offline.
Still having trouble? Email linksysappfeedback@belkin.com

Thanks to your feedback, in this release we fixed:
• An "unexpected error" on EA6350 and EA6900. If you've seen this, set your Parental Controls rules again.
• An "unexpected error" when adding a router to your account. Update your firmware if you still see this.
• An "unexpected error" saving Parental Controls rules.
• "Log in locally" option may not appear.
• Online router appearing offline.
Still having trouble? Email linksysappfeedback@belkin.com

Thanks to your feedback, in this release we:
• Fixed router password login to work with old firmware. For cloud access, make sure firmware is up to date.
• Added error message if connected with LTE, but previously used password for direct login.
• Fixed one type of rare unexpected error on login.
• Made it easier to give us feedback.
Still having trouble? Email linksysappfeedback@belkin.com

Still having trouble? Email linksysappfeedback@belkin.com

Thanks to your feedback, in this release we:

Still having trouble? Email linksysappfeedback@belkin.com

IMPORTANT: Due to an improvement to the Internet security standards used by our cloud service, we recommend you get the latest version of the Linksys Smart Wi-Fi app. Older versions of the app will stop working for some users October 5, 2016.

Once you’ve got the new app, please take a moment to see that your router’s firmware is up-to-date or being updated automatically.

Still having trouble? Email linksysappfeedback@belkin.com

IMPORTANT: Due to an improvement to the Internet security standards used by our cloud service, we recommend you get the latest version of the Linksys Smart Wi-Fi app. Older versions of the app will stop working for some users October 5, 2016.

Once you’ve got the new app, please take a moment to see that your router’s firmware is up-to-date or being updated automatically.

IMPORTANT: Due to an improvement to the Internet security standards used by our cloud service, we recommend you get the latest version of the Linksys Smart Wi-Fi app. Older versions of the app will stop working for some users October 5, 2016.

Once you’ve got the new app, please take a moment to see that your router’s firmware is up-to-date or being updated automatically.

Still having trouble? Email linksysappfeedback@belkin.com

Thanks for your feedback. You helped us fix some elusive bugs and plan future improvements.

In this release, we:
• Fixed an error when enabling notifications (with EA9500 and EA9400 routers)
• Fixed an error seen by some when saving parental controls or MAC filtering
• Improved overall performance and made miscellaneous fixes

Adds support for Velop, a modular system of tri-band connection points that provide seamless, full-strength Wi-Fi for the whole family.

Thanks to all our users for their feedback. Your input helped us improve Velop’s user experience.
What’s new:
- More reliable setup of additional nodes
- More reliable setup for nodes set up on PPPoE internet connections
- More reliable saving of Wi-Fi settings (for non-U.S. regions)
- Improved design of setup screens

Thanks to all our users for their feedback. Your input helped us improve your Wi-Fi experience.
Fixes in this update:
- Some non-Velop devices showing up in Velop Administration
- Guest network name is now available on both 2.4 and 5GHz bands
- Configure PPPoE if your ISP doesn’t require a password
You can now:
- Use more complex passwords for your account
- Select from Amazon Echo, Dot, Tap, and Wemo Mini device icons

- More dependable Velop speed test
- Improved setup for all devices
- Miscellaneous bugs solved
You can now:
- See which Velop node your devices are connected to

We listened to you and improved your Wi-Fi experience. Keep the feedback coming.

You can now:
- Schedule Parental Controls in the app. Available for Velop and all app-enabled routers.
- Set up Velop in Bridge/AP mode to keep an existing router or modem-router online.

Fixes in this update:
- Separated devices on Velop guest networks from those connected to main Wi-Fi
- Improved login for some users
- Miscellaneous bugs solved

Please be sure your firmware is up to date so you can enjoy these improvements.

With your comments we improved the experience for Linksys routers and Velop systems.

Soon you can (Velop firmware update available late June):
- View the signal strength of devices on your Wi-Fi.
- View more accurate online status of devices on your Wi-Fi.

Fixes in this update:
- Improved login for some users.
- Solved miscellaneous bugs.

Please be sure your firmware is up to date so you can enjoy these improvements.

If you can’t access your router remotely, restart it. That fixes many small issues.

Thanks to your feedback we've improved Linksys routers and Velop systems.
Now you can:
- See what node your nodes are connected to.
- Configure DNS settings and your local DHCP IP address range.
Fixes in this update:
- App opens faster for known networks.
- More help provided for login issues.
- Solved miscellaneous bugs.
Please be sure your firmware is up to date so you can enjoy these improvements.
If you can't access your router remotely, restart it. That fixes many small issues.

Linksys routers and Velop systems are better, thanks to your input.
If you have an EA8300 with the latest firmware, you can now:
- Run a speed check.
- Configure all band steering options.
- Enable link aggregation (Advanced Settings > Local Network Settings).
Fixes in this update:
- Solved miscellaneous bugs.
If you can’t access your router remotely, restart it. That fixes many small issues.

• Velop Channel Finder feature better handles networks with five or more nodes
• Display improvements for iPhone X

Introducing Linksys Aware, motion detection for Velop tri-band users. Subscribers get notified if motion meets or exceeds their sensitivity level. Requires a tri-band parent node with the Linksys Aware update and at least one child node connected wirelessly to your mesh Wi-Fi.

We fixed some bugs, too. Keep sending us input to make us better. Send suggestions to LinksysAppFeedback@belkin.com

Introducing Linksys Aware, motion detection for Velop tri-band users. Subscribers get notified if motion meets or exceeds their sensitivity level. Requires a tri-band parent node with the Linksys Aware update and at least one tri-band child node connected wirelessly, to the parent node or a tri-band node with the Linksys Aware update.

We fixed some bugs, too. Keep sending us input to make us better. Send suggestions to LinksysAppFeedback@belkin.com

For this release, we added IPv6 pass-through as an internet connection type for Velop and mesh-enabled routers. We've also thrown in a handful of improvements to the Velop setup process.

Keep helping us get better. Send suggestions to LinksysAppFeedback@belkin.com.

This release fixes minor bugs, including an issue some were having with manual firmware updates for Velop systems.

Keep helping us get better. Send suggestions to LinksysAppFeedback@belkin.com.

Connecting our loose ends to get you connected to Wi-Fi faster.

Updates we’ve made:

• Released a critical firmware update for Velop dual-band that will get you more speed and range.
• Added our phone number to more screens in setup to make it easier for you to get in touch with us when you need us.
• Dramatically improved our handling of errors when adding an additional node. Adding nodes to your network should be much smoother now.

Velop Plug-in has arrived! We made a bunch of app updates to support our newest node.

We also made fixes, so you can now:

• More easily add a new node to a Velop system with a custom power table
• Contact support directly from even more screens in setup
• We also fixed some rare troubleshooting and Bluetooth bugs

Have suggestions? Send them to LinksysAppFeedback@belkin.com

Introducing Linksys Shield, a subscription service for Velop Tri-Band users that enhances parental controls. With a firmware update in early February, Linksys Shield allows you to block categories of web content and defend against malicious websites. Look for the new feature on your Linksys app dashboard.

Have suggestions? Send them to LinksysAppFeedback@belkin.com.

We fixed some bugs, too. Keep sending us input to make us better. Send suggestions to LinksysAppFeedback@belkin.com

Introducing Linksys Shield, a subscription service for Velop Tri-Band users that enhances parental controls. With a firmware update in early February, Linksys Shield allows you to block categories of web content and defend against malicious websites. Look for the new feature on your Linksys app dashboard.

Have suggestions? Send them to LinksysAppFeedback@belkin.com.

Velop Plug-in has arrived! We made a bunch of app updates to support our newest node.

We also made fixes, so you can now:

• More easily add a new node to a Velop system with a custom power table
• Contact support directly from even more screens in setup
• We also fixed some rare troubleshooting and Bluetooth bugs

Have suggestions? Send them to LinksysAppFeedback@belkin.com

Meet the MR8300, a mesh-capable router in a traditional router's body! With this update you can use MR8300 as a parent node for whole home mesh WiFi. Add Velop nodes for complete home coverage or use the MR8300 as a standalone router.

We packed in some bug fixes, including improved setup when Bluetooth connectivity is weak, and consistent display of speed check feature.

Have suggestions? Send them to LinksysAppFeedback@belkin.com

Introducing Linksys Aware, motion detection for Velop tri-band users. Subscribers get notified if motion meets or exceeds their sensitivity level. Requires a tri-band parent node with the Linksys Aware update and at least one tri-band child node connected wirelessly, to the parent node or a tri-band node with the Linksys Aware update.

We fixed some bugs, too. Keep sending us input to make us better. Send suggestions to LinksysAppFeedback@belkin.com

Now you can lock down your smart home devices with Velop and Apple Home. Your Velop tri-band system now works with the Apple Home app to provide added security to your HomeKit accessories and the rest of your network. All you need is your Velop system and an Apple home hub, such as an Apple TV, iPad or HomePod, running the latest version of software.

Add an extra layer of security to your Linksys account with 2-Step Verification. Choose to receive a verification code by email or text when logging in from an unfamiliar device.

We love hearing from you. Send suggestions to LinksysAppFeedback@belkin.com.
